009package Ch21_GeometricOperations;
010
011import java.awt.Font;
012import java.awt.Graphics2D;
013
014import ij.ImagePlus;
015import ij.plugin.PlugIn;
016import ij.process.ByteProcessor;
017import imagingbook.common.image.ImageGraphics;
018
019/**
020 * <p>
021 * This ImageJ plugin draws a test grid in a new image. It uses anti-aliased
022 * drawing operations provided by imagingbook's {@link ImageGraphics} class.
023 * Used in [1] for testing geometric transformations (see Fig. 21.6) and
024 * interpolation methods (see Fig. 22.25).
025 * </p>
026 * <p>
027 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An
028 * Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
029 * </p>
030 * 
031 * @author WB
032 * @version 2022/11/28
033 * 
034 * @see ImageGraphics
035 */
036public class Draw_Test_Grid implements PlugIn {
037        
038        private static int W = 400;
039        private static int H = 400;
040        private static int xStep = 20;
041        private static int yStep = 20;
042        private static int xStart = 100;
043        private static int yStart = 100;
044        private static int xN = 10;
045        private static int yN = 10;
046        
047        private static int foreground = 0;
048        private static int background = 255;
049        
050    @Override
051        public void run(String arg) {
052        ByteProcessor ip = new ByteProcessor(W, H);
053        ip.setValue(background);
054        ip.fill();
055        
056        try (ImageGraphics ig = new ImageGraphics(ip)) {
057                        ig.setColor(foreground);
058                        ig.setLineWidth(1.0);
059                        
060                        int y = yStart;
061                int x1 = xStart;
062                int x2 = xStart + xN * xStep;
063                        for (int j = 0; j <= yN; j++) {
064                                ig.drawLine(x1, y, x2, y);
065                                y = y + yStep;
066                        }
067                        
068                        int x = xStart;
069                        int y1 = yStart;
070                        int y2 = yStart + yN * yStep;
071                        for (int i = 0; i <= xN; i++) {
072                                ig.drawLine(x, y1, x, y2);
073                                x = x + xStep;
074                        }
075                        
076                        ig.drawLine(0, 0, W - 1, H - 1);
077                        ig.drawOval(xStart, yStart, W/2, H/2);
078                        
079                        Graphics2D g = ig.getGraphics2D();
080                        g.setFont(new Font(Font.SANS_SERIF, Font.PLAIN, 18));
081                        float xLeft = 8;
082                        float yTop  = 19;
083                        float xRight = W - 17;
084                        float yBot  = H - 10;
085                        g.drawString("1", xLeft, yTop);
086                        g.drawString("2", xRight, yTop);
087                        g.drawString("3", xRight, yBot);
088                        g.drawString("4", xLeft, yBot);
089        }
090        
091        new ImagePlus("Grid",ip).show();
092    }
093}
